dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Form a cement grout vertical barrier that can prevent the migration of radioactive isotopes from contaminated soil to groundwater, with a barrier capacity of 83 cubic meters.
本工业流程用于环境修复目的，特别是用于污染场地的原位地下水修复。其意图是形成水泥浆垂直障碍，以防止放射性同位素从受污染土壤迁移到地下水中。这项技术适用于大型环境清洁项目，例如因过去安全措施不当导致放射性同位素污染土壤和地下水的超级基金（Superfund）计划分类下的项目。

locationOfOperationSupplyOrProduction.descriptionOfRestrictions: For this project, a Superfund location at the Brookhaven National Laboratory (BNL) is studied. This particular case was chosen because it is representative of the scale and scenario where soil grouting would be used. It is also one of only a few sites where CS grouting has been used for full scale remediation. BNL has served as a production facility for research and development of radioisotopes for decades. The design of some of the facilities failed to provide adequate safety measures against the spread of radioactivity to the soils and groundwater beneath them and as a result, BNL was added to the Superfund National Priorities List in 1989.

technology.technologicalApplicability: The industrial process described is used for environmental remediation purposes, specifically for in-situ groundwater remediation at contaminated sites. It is intended for forming a cement grout vertical barrier to prevent the migration of radioactive isotopes from contaminated soil into the groundwater. This technique is relevant for use in large-scale environmental clean-up projects, such as those classified under the Superfund program, where soil and groundwater contamination by radioisotopes has occurred due to inadequate safety measures in the past.

dataSourcesTreatmentAndRepresentativenes.useAdviceForDataSet: When applying this data set for modeling and assessment, users should ensure that the scale and scenarios of the environmental remediation align with those of a Superfund location. Specific attention should be paid to the volume of the cement grout barrier (83 cubic meters in the case study) and the effectiveness of the barrier against the particular radioactive isotopes present. Users must consider the technological applicability of the soil grouting method along with its implementation challenges. Data should only be used for in-situ remediation cases where similar containment methodologies are applicable and feasible.
在使用该数据集进行建模和评估时，用户应确保环境修复的规模和情景与超级基金地点的规模和情景一致。应特别注意水泥浆障碍的体积（在案例研究中为83立方米）以及障碍物对存在的特定放射性同位素的防护效果。用户必须考虑土壤灌浆法的技术适用性及其实施挑战。数据只应用于原位修复案例，其中类似的隔离方法是适用和可行的。
